title: Owls Overhead
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 281 words, Level I (Grade 1), Lexile 560L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     L and O
description: Owls may seem strange and mysterious, but that only makes them more fascinating. In Owls Overhead, students will learn about the different adaptations that allow these amazing predatory birds to survive in the wild. Brilliant, detailed photographs support the text and capture readers' attention. Readers will also have the opportunity to learn about main ideas, details, and complete sentences. Book and lesson are also available at levels L and O.
meta: attack, darkness, hearing, hunt, prey, survive
Ask and answer questions to understand text
Main Idea and Details : Determine main idea and details
Complete Sentences : Understand and use complete sentences

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
